doc.previous: New models are beginning to show how kinetic friction can be greater than static friction 26 Kinetic friction is now understood in many cases to be primarily caused by chemical bonding between the surfaces rather than interlocking asperities 27 however in many other cases roughness effects are dominant for example in rubber to road friction 26 Surface roughness and contact area however do affect kinetic friction for micro and nano scale objects where surface area forces dominate inertial forces 28
